tuv.seg: La Vita Nuova
新生
The day her fiance left, Amanda went walking in the Colonial cemetery off Garden Street.
阿曼达的未婚夫离去那天，她离开花园街去了殖民地公墓散步。
The gravestones were so worn that she could hardly read them.
墓碑十分破旧，她几乎无法读出它们。
They were melting away into the weedy grass.
它们正逐渐消失在杂草丛中。
You are a very dark person, her fiance had said.
你是一个非常忧郁的人，她的未婚夫曾说过。
She walked home and sat in her half-empty closet.
她走回家，坐在她那半空的衣橱里。
Her vintage nineteen-fifties wedding dress hung in clear asphyxiating plastic printed "NOT A TOY."
她的老式的1950年代的婚纱礼服挂在明亮的令人窒息的塑料袋里，上面印着“ 不是玩具。”
She took the dress to work.
她把婚纱礼服带去工作的地方。
She hooked the hanger onto a grab bar on the T and the dress rustled and swayed.
她把衣架挂在地铁车厢里的扶手杆上，衣服沙沙地响着，摇摆着。
When she got out at Harvard Square, the guy who played guitar near the turnstiles called, "Congratulations."
当她在哈佛广场站走出来的时候，那个在旋转闸口附近的弹吉他的人喊道，“恭喜你。"
Work was at the Garden School, where Amanda taught art, including theatre, puppets, storytelling, drumming, dance, and now fabric painting.
工作的地方是在花园学校，在那里阿曼达教艺术，包括戏剧，木偶，讲故事，击鼓，舞蹈，现在是织布绘画。
She spread the white satin gown on the art-room floor.
她把那件白色缎子礼服摊开放在艺术课教室的地板上。
Two girls glued pink feathers all along the hem.
两个女孩沿着下摆贴满了粉红色的羽毛。
Others brushed the skirt with green and purple.
其他人则在裙子上刷上绿色和紫色。
A boy named Nathaniel dipped his hand in red paint and left his little handprint on the bodice as though the dress were an Indian pony.
一个名叫纳撒尼尔的男孩把他的手浸在红色油漆里，然后把他的小手印印在胸衣上，仿佛这件衣服是一匹印第安小马。
At lunchtime, the principal asked Amanda to step into her office.
午饭时间，校长叫阿曼达去她的办公室。
You are like living with a dark cloud, Amanda's fiance had told her when he left.
你就像是和乌云生活在一起，阿曼达的未婚夫离开她时对她说过。
You're always sad.
你总是一幅忧伤的样子。
I'm sad now, Amanda had said.
我现在就很忧伤，阿曼达曾说过。
The principal told Amanda that, for an educator, boundaries were an issue.
校长告诉阿曼达，身为一个教育工作者，要注意做事的场合。
"Your personal life,"said the principal, "is not an appropriate art project for first grade.
“你的个人生活，”校长说，“不是一个适合一年级的艺术项目。
Your classroom,"said the principal, "is not an appropriate forum for your relationships.
你的教室，”校长说，“不是为你的个人关系开的一个适当的论坛。
Let's pack up the wedding dress."
把那件结婚礼服包起来吧。”
"It's still wet,"Amanda said.
“它还是湿的呢，”阿曼达说。
Her mother could not believe it.
她的妈妈简直不敢相信这件事。
She had just sent out all the invitations.
她刚刚寄出了所有的邀请。
Her father swore he'd kill the son of a bitch.
她的爸爸发誓他要杀了这个婊子养的。
They both asked how this could have happened, but they remembered that they had had doubts all along.
他们都问怎么会成这样，但他们记得，他们一直都存有疑虑。
Her sister Lissa said she could not imagine what Amanda was going through.
她的姐姐利萨说，她无法想象阿曼达正在经历着什么。
She must feel so terrible.
她肯定感觉很糟糕。
Was Amanda going to have to write to everyone on the guest list?
阿曼达是否不得不给客人名单上所有的人写个通知？
Like a card or something?
比如一个卡片或别的什么东西？
She'd have to tell everybody, wouldn't she?
她不得不告诉每一个人，是不是？
I waited all this time because I didn't want to hurt you, Amanda's fiance had said.
这段时间我一直在等，因为我不想伤害你，阿曼达的未婚夫说过。
After school, she went for a drink with the old blond gym teacher, Patsy.
放学后，她和年老的金发的体育教师帕齐去喝饮料。
They went to a bar called Cambridge Common and ordered gin-and-tonics.
他们去了一家叫剑桥公地的酒吧，并点了杜松子酒和汤力水。
Patsy said, "Eventually, you're going to realize that this is a blessing in disguise."
帕齐说，“最终，你会认识到这是一个变相的祝福。”
"We had too many differences,"said Amanda.
“我们有太多的不同，”阿曼达说。
Patsy lifted her glass.
帕齐举起杯子。
"There you go."
“说说看。”
"For example, I loved him and he didn't love me."
“例如，我爱他，而他不爱我。”
"Don't be surprised,"said Patsy, "if he immediately marries someone else.
“你可不要惊讶，”帕齐说，“如果他立即和别人结了婚。
Guys like that immediately marry someone else."
像这样的家伙立即和别人结了婚。”
"Why?"Amanda asked.
“为什么？”阿曼达问。
Patsy sighed.
帕齐叹了口气。
"If I knew that, I'd be teaching at Harvard, not teaching the professors' kids."
“如果我知道为什么，我就应该在哈佛大学教书，而不是教教授的孩子。”
Amanda tried writing a card or something.
阿曼达在尝试写一个卡片或别的什么。
She wrote that she and her fiance had decided not to marry.
她写道，她和她的未婚夫已经决定不结婚了。
Then she wrote that her fiance had decided not to marry her.
然后她写道，她的未婚夫已经决定不和她结婚了。
She said that she was sorry for any inconvenience.
她说，她为带来的任何不便深表歉意。
She added that she would appreciate gifts anyway.
她又补充说，不管怎样，她很感激收到礼物。
Her parents told her not to send the card.
她的父母告诉她不要寄出卡片。
They said that they were coming up for a week.
他们说，他们会过来一个星期。
She said that they couldn't come, because she was painting her apartment.
她说他们不能来，因为她在给她的公寓喷漆。
She did not paint the apartment.
她并没有给她的公寓喷漆。
In the winter, Amanda cut her hair short like a boy's.
在冬季，阿曼达把头发剪的像一个男孩那么短。
"Oh, your hair,"said Patsy.
“哦，你的头发，”帕齐说。
"Your beautiful curls."
“你的漂亮的卷发。”
In the spring, the principal told Amanda that, regretfully, she was not being renewed for the following year, because the art program at the Garden School was moving in a different direction.
在春季，校长告诉阿曼达说，很遗憾，她没有被续签到下一年，因为花园学校的艺术项目在朝一个不同的方向发展。
In the summer, Amanda's fiance married someone else.
在夏季，阿曼达的未婚夫和别人结婚了。
When school ended, Amanda took a job babysitting Nathaniel, the boy with the red handprint.
当学校工作结束后，阿曼达接了一个照顾纳撒尼尔的保姆工作，就是那个红手印的男孩。
Nathaniel's mother asked for stimulating activities, projects, science.
纳撒尼尔的妈妈要求安排一些有趣的活动，项目，科学。
No TV.
不可以看电视。
Nathaniel's father didn't ask for anything.
纳撒尼尔的爸爸没有要求任何事情。
Their first day together, Amanda asked Nathaniel, "What do you want to do?"
他们第一天在一起的时候，阿曼达问纳撒尼尔，“你想做什么？”
"Nothing."
“没什么想做的。”
She said, "You read my mind."
她说：“你读懂了我的心。”
They ate chocolate mice at Burdick's and then they stood in front of the Harvard Coop and listened to Peruvian musicians.
他们在伯迪克店吃老鼠巧克力，然后他们站在哈佛合作社书店前，听秘鲁音乐家的音乐。
They explored the cemetery, and Amanda told Nathaniel that the gravestones were dragons' teeth.
他们探讨了墓地，阿曼达告诉纳撒尼尔墓碑是龙的牙齿。

They walked down to the river and she said, "If you trace the river all the way to the beginning, you'll find a magic cave."They took the T to Boston and stood in line for the swan boats in the Public Garden.
他们往下走到河边，她说：“如果你一路追溯这条河到源头，你会发现一个神奇的洞穴。”他们乘坐地铁去了波士顿，在大众花园里排队坐天鹅船。
She said, "At night, these boats turn into real swans."
她说：“到了晚上，这些船会变成真正的天鹅。”
Nathaniel said, "You have a great imagination."
纳撒尼尔说：“你有了不起的想象力。”
His mother lived in a Victorian house on Buckingham Street.
他的妈妈住在白金汉街上的一栋维多利亚式住宅里。
She worked at the Media Lab at M.I.T. and she had deadlines.
她在麻省理工学院的媒体实验室工作，有工作期限。
The house had a garden full of flowers, but Nathaniel didn't play there, because you couldn't really dig.
这所住宅有一个开满了花的花园，但纳撒尼尔并不在那里玩，因为你不能真地去挖地。
His father lived in an upside-down town house on Chauncy Street.
他的爸爸住在昌街上一座上下颠倒的独栋住宅里。
The bedrooms were on the bottom floors, and the kitchen and living room on top.
卧室在底层，厨房和客厅在顶层。
His father was writing a book and he came home late.
他的爸爸正在写一本书，很晚才回家。
Amanda and Nathaniel had pizza delivered to Chauncy Street and watched Charlie Chaplin movies from Hollywood Express.
阿曼达和纳撒尼尔订了比萨送到昌街，看着来自好莱坞快递的查理卓别林的影片。
Sometimes they spread a sheet over the couch and ate a big bowl of popcorn.
有时候，他们在沙发铺一张床单，然后吃一大碗爆米花。
It's hard to be with you, her fiance had said.
和你相处很困难，她的未婚夫说过。
I feel like I'm suffocating.
我感觉好像就要窒息了。
Open a window, Amanda had said.
打开一扇窗户吧，阿曼达说过。
When the movie was done, Amanda gathered the sheet and stepped onto the balcony, where she shook out the crumbs.
影片结束以后，阿曼达收起床单，走到阳台上，把碎屑抖掉。
Amanda and Nathaniel had playdates with his friends at Walden Pond.
阿曼达和纳撒尼尔曾和他的朋友们在瓦尔登湖一起玩过。
They went canoeing on the Charles, and Nathaniel dropped his paddle in the water.
他们一起去查尔斯湖划独木舟，纳撒尼尔把船桨掉到了水里。
Amanda almost tipped the boat, trying to fish it out.
阿曼达试图把船桨打捞出来，差点弄翻了船。
They wrote a book about pirates.
他们写了一本关于海盗的书。
Nathaniel told the stories and Amanda typed them on the computer in his father's study.
在他爸爸的书房里，由纳撒尼尔来讲故事，阿曼达则把故事键入电脑。
"Aarrr, matey,"she typed, "I'm stuck on a ship."
“哎，朋友，”她打着，“我被困在一条船上了。”
When his father stayed out past Nathaniel's bedtime, Amanda tucked Nathaniel in, and then she read books in the study.
当他的爸爸在外面呆过了纳撒尼尔的睡觉时间的时候，阿曼达会给纳撒尼尔盖好，然后她就在书房阅读书籍。
The books were about American history.
那些书是关于美国历史的。
She read only a few pages of each, so she didn't learn anything.
每本书她都只读了几页，所以她并没有学到任何东西。
If you ever stopped to listen, her fiance had said, then you would understand.
如果你曾停下来去聆听，她的未婚夫说过，那么你就会明白。
She stood on a chair and pulled out some small paperbacks from the top shelf.
她站在椅子上，从书架顶层抽出一些小开本的平装书。
Dante, "The Divine Comedy,"in a new translation.
但丁，“神曲”，一个新的译本。
Boccaccio, "The Decameron,"Chaucer's "Canterbury Tales,"complete and unabridged.
薄伽丘，“十日谈”，乔叟的“坎特伯雷故事集”，足本未删节版。
Dante again, "La Vita Nuova."
还是但丁，“新生。”
"La Vita Nuova"explained how to become a great poet.
“新生”讲解了如何成为一名伟大的诗人。
The secret was to fall in love with a perfect girl but never speak to her.
秘诀就是去爱上一个完美的女孩，但绝不和她说话。
You should weep instead.
你反而应该哭泣。
You should pretend that you love someone else.
你应该假装你爱另外一个人。
You should write sonnets in three parts.
你应该写一些十四行诗，分成三个部分。
Your perfect girl should die.
您的完美女孩应该死去。
Amanda's mother said, "You have your whole life ahead of you."
阿曼达的妈妈说：“你的整个人生都提前了。”
She fell asleep on the couch waiting for Nathaniel's father to come home.
她倒在沙发上睡着了，等着纳撒尼尔的爸爸回家。
When she woke up, she saw him kneeling in front of her.
当她醒来时，她看见他跪在她面前。
She said, "What's wrong?"
她说：“你怎么了？”
He said, "Nothing's wrong.
他说，“没什么。
I'm sorry.
对不起。
I didn't want to wake you."
我没想弄醒你。”
But he did wake her.
但他的确弄醒了她。
She went home and stayed awake all night.
她回到家里，彻夜未眠。
"Let's go somewhere,"she told Nathaniel the next day.
“我们去个地方，”第二天她对纳撒尼尔说。
"Where?"
“哪里？”
"Far away."
“很远。”
They took the T to Ashmont, at the end of the Red Line.
他们乘坐地铁去阿什莫特站，红线的终点站。
They sat together in the rattling car and talked about doughnuts.
在卡塔卡塔响的车上他们坐在一起，谈论着面包圈。
"I like cinnamon doughnuts, but they make me cough,"Nathaniel said.
“我喜欢肉桂面包圈，但是它们会让我咳嗽，”纳撒尼尔说。
She slept lightly.
她轻轻地睡着了。
She dreamed she was walking with Nathaniel in a pine forest.
她梦见她和纳撒尼尔走在一片松树林里。
She was telling him not to step on the dead hummingbirds.
她在告诉他不要踩到死的蜂鸟。
The birds were sapphire-throated, brilliant blue.
这种鸟是天蓝色脖子的，灿烂的蓝色。
She stole "La Vita Nuova."
她偷了“新生。”
It was just a paperback.
只不过是一本平装书。
Her sister called to check in.
她的姐姐打了电话去登记。
Her friend Jamie said she knew someone she'd like Amanda to meet.
她的朋友杰米说她认识一个人，她希望阿曼达去见见。
Amanda said, "Soon."
阿曼达说：“快了。”
Jamie said, "What exactly are you waiting for?"
杰米说：“你到底在等什么呢？”
Nathaniel's father pretended not to look at her.
纳撒尼尔的爸爸假装没有看她。
Amanda pretended not to notice his dark eyes.
阿曼达假装没有留意到他邪恶的眼睛。
"The question is what you're going to do in September,"Amanda's mother told her on the phone.
“问题是在9月你会去做什么，”阿曼达的妈妈在电话里告诉她。
"The question is what you're going to do with your life,"her father said.
“问题是你的生活要怎么过，”她爸爸说。
Dante wrote, "O you who on the road of Love pass by, / Attend and see / If any grief there be as heavy as mine."
但丁写道，“哦，你们行进在爱情的旅途，请驻足少待，看看清楚，谁的痛苦竟像我的那样严重。”
"When was the last time you painted anything?"her mother asked.
“你最后一次做画是什么时候？”她的妈妈问。
"Apart from your apartment?"
“搬离你的公寓了？”
Her father said, "I paid for Yale."
她的爸爸说，“我为你的耶鲁学业付了学费。”
All day, Amanda and Nathaniel studied the red ants of Buckingham Street.
一整天，阿曼达和纳撒尼尔都在研究白金汉街的红蚂蚁。
They experimented with cake crumbs and observed the ants change course to eat them.
他们用蛋糕屑做试验，观察到蚂蚁们改变了行走路线去吃它们。
Nathaniel considered becoming an entomologist when he grew up.
纳撒尼尔考虑着长大当一名昆虫学家。
The next day, he decided to open his own ice-cream store.
第二天，他决定开他自己的冰淇淋店。
They biked to Christina's, in Inman Square.
他们骑车去了位于因曼广场的克里斯蒂娜店。
Nathaniel pedalled in front on his little bike.
纳撒尼尔在前面骑着他的小自行车。
Amanda pedalled behind on her big bike and watched for cars.
阿曼达在后面骑着她的大自行车，同时警惕着汽车。
At Christina's, Nathaniel could read almost all the flavors on the board: adzuki bean, black raspberry, burnt sugar, chocolate banana, chocolate orange, cardamom.
在克里斯蒂娜店，纳撒尼尔可以找到板上写着的几乎所有的口味：红豆，黑树莓，焦糖，巧克力，香蕉，巧克力橙，小豆蔻。
Nathaniel said, "I'll have vanilla."They sat in front near the bulletin board with ads for guitar lessons, tutoring, transcendental meditation.
纳撒尼尔说：“我要香草的。”他们坐在附近的公告栏前，上面有一些广告，吉他课的，家教的，还有超觉冥想课的。
"What's an egg donor?"Nathaniel said.
“什么是卵子捐赠者？”纳撒尼尔说。
I want to be with you for the rest of my life, her fiance had told her once.
我想和你在一起度过我的余生，她的未婚夫曾对她说过她一次。
You are my best friend, he had written on her birthday card.
你是我最好的朋友，他曾在给她的生日卡上写着。
You make me smile, you make me laugh.
你让我微笑，你让我大笑。
"Love weeps,"Dante wrote.
“爱神哭泣了，”但丁写道。
"Could I have a quarter for a gumball?"Nathaniel asked Amanda.
“我能拿二十五美分买一个口香糖吗？”纳撒尼尔问阿曼达。
"You just had ice cream,"she said.
“你刚刚吃完冰淇淋，”她说。
"Please."
“求你了！”
"No!
“不行！
You just had ice cream.
你刚刚吃完冰淇淋。
You don't need candy."
你不可以吃糖。”
"Please, please, please,"he said.
“求你了，求你了，求你了，”他说。
"You're lovely,"Nathaniel's father whispered to Amanda late that night.
“你真可爱，”那天深夜纳撒尼尔的爸爸低声对阿曼达说。
She was just leaving, and he'd opened the door for her.
当时她正准备离开，他为她打开了门。
"You're not supposed to say that,"Amanda whispered back.
“你不应该这样说，”阿曼达小声回答。
"You're supposed to write a sonnet."
“你应该去写一首十四行诗。”
Nathaniel said that he knew what to do when you were upset.
纳撒尼尔说他知道当你难过的时候该去做什么。
She said, "Tell me, Nathaniel."
她说，“告诉我，纳撒尼尔。”
He said, "Go to the zoo."
他说，“去动物园。”
Nathaniel studied the train schedule.
纳撒尼尔研究了列车时刻表。
They took the Orange Line to Ruggles Station and then the No. 22 bus to the Franklin Park Zoo.
他们乘坐橘色线去拉格尔斯站，然后乘22路巴士到富兰克林动物园。
They watched orangutans sitting on their haunches, shredding newspapers, one page at a time.
他们观看猩猩臀部着地坐着，撕扯着报纸，每次撕一张。
They climbed up on viewing platforms to observe the giraffes.
他们爬上观景平台观察长颈鹿。
They ran down every path.
他们跑完了每一条路。
They looked at snakes.
他们看了蛇。
They went to the little barnyard and a goat frightened Nathaniel.
他们去了一个小谷仓，一只山羊吓到了纳撒尼尔。
Amanda said the goat was just curious.
阿曼达说山羊只是好奇而已。
She said, "Goats wouldn't eat you."
她说：“山羊不会吃你的。”
Nathaniel fell asleep on the T on the way home.
回家的路上纳撒尼尔在地铁里睡着了。
He leaned against Amanda and closed his eyes.
他靠在阿曼达身上合上了眼睛。
The woman sitting next to Amanda said, "He's beautiful."
坐在阿曼达旁边的女人说：“他真漂亮。”
Amanda's friend Jamie had a party in Somerville.
阿曼达的朋友杰米在萨默维尔举行一个派对。
The wine was terrible.
那种酒太烈了。
The friend that Jamie wanted Amanda to meet was drunk.
杰米希望阿曼达认识的那个朋友喝醉了。
Amanda got drunk, too, but it didn't help.
阿曼达也喝醉了，但是没有帮助。
She was late to work the next day.
第二天她晚到了。
She found Nathaniel waiting on his mother's porch.
她发现纳撒尼尔在他妈妈的门廊等着。
"I thought you were sick,"he said.
“我以为你生病了，”他说。
"I was,"she told him.
“我是生病了，”她对他说。
They walked to Harvard Square and watched the street magicians.
他们走到哈佛广场观看了街头魔术师表演。
They went to Le's and shared vegetarian summer rolls and Thai iced tea.
他们去了‘乐’餐馆一起分享素食夏季卷和泰国冰茶。
"This tastes like orange chalk,"Nathaniel said.
“这个尝起来就像橙色粉笔，”纳撒尼尔说。
They went to a store called Little Russia and looked at the lacquered dolls there.
他们去了一家叫小俄罗斯的商店，并在那里观看漆面玩偶。
"See, they come apart,"Amanda told Nathaniel.
“瞧，他们分开来了，”阿曼达告诉纳撒尼尔。
"You pop open this lady, and inside there's another, and another, and another."
“你弹开这个夫人，里面还有另一个，然后还有另一个，然后还有另一个。”
"Do not touch, please,"the saleslady told them.
“请不要触摸，”女售货员对他们说。
They walked down to the river and sat on the grass under a tree and talked about their favorite dogs.
他们往下走到河边，坐在一棵大树下的草地上，谈论他们最喜欢的狗。
"Labradoodle,"Amanda said.
“拉布拉多德利犬，”阿曼达说。
Nathaniel giggled.
纳撒尼尔咯咯地笑起来。
"No, Schnoodle."
“不，史努多犬。”
"Golden Streudel."
“金毛史莱德犬。”
Nathaniel said, "Is that the kind you had when you were young?"
纳撒尼尔说：“就是你年轻的时候养的那种？”
She dreamed that she was a Russian doll.
她梦见她是一个俄罗斯玩偶。
Inside her was a smaller version of herself, and inside that an even smaller version.
在里面是一个小版的自己，然后在里面是一个更加小版的自己。
She ordered a set of blank wooden dolls online and began painting them.
她在网上订购了一套空白的木制玩偶，开始给它们涂色。
